question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: unstake_n_sui()] [Precision Loss] Does the ceiling division formula on line 178 lose precision for small sui_amount_out values, causing systematic over-redemption that drains lst_balance over many operations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: unstake_n_sui()] [Ratio Manipulation] Can an attacker manipulate total_sui_supply or total_lst_supply through external liquid_staking interactions to inflate lst_to_redeem calculation, extracting excess value? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: claim_fees()] [Subtraction Underflow] If total_sui_supply < staker.liabilities + MIST_PER_SUI on line 141, can the else branch return 0 even when fees are legitimately owed, causing fee loss? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: claim_fees()] [Arithmetic Error] Can the excess_sui calculation on line 142 underflow if staker.liabilities increases between total_sui_supply computation and the subtraction, causing a panic? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: total_sui_supply()] [Overflow] Can staker.liquid_staking_info.total_sui_supply() + staker.sui_balance.value() overflow u64 on line 46, causing wraparound and breaking invariant checks? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: unstake_n_sui()] [Rounding Attack] Can an attacker call withdraw() with amount = sui_balance + 1 repeatedly to trigger minimal unstake_n_sui() calls with ceiling rounding, slowly draining extra value from lst_balance? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: unstake_n_sui()] [Edge Case] When total_sui_supply - 1 == sui_amount_out * total_lst_supply / total_sui_supply, does the +total_sui_supply-1 term cause lst_to_redeem to round up by 2 instead of 1, over-redeeming LST? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: claim_fees()] [Invariant Violation] Although claim_fees() checks total_sui_supply() >= liabilities on line 154, can race conditions between refresh() and the check allow the invariant to be violated before the assertion? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: claim_fees()] [Invariant Bypass] If unstake_n_sui() on line 149 fails silently or returns less SUI than expected, can excess_sui still be split out, breaking the invariant that total_sui_supply >= liabilities? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: withdraw()] [Invariant Missing] Why doesn't withdraw() verify total_sui_supply() >= liabilities after withdrawing, allowing scenarios where liabilities exceed actual backing to persist undetected? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: deposit()] [Invariant Missing] Since deposit() increases liabilities without checking if total_sui_supply will remain >= liabilities + sui.value(), can deposits break the invariant when sui_balance is low? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: rebalance()] [Invariant Risk] After rebalance() converts all sui_balance to lst_balance and stakes it, if the validator slash event occurs, can total_sui_supply drop below liabilities permanently? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Struct: Staker] [Invariant Design] Should there be an invariant check that lst_balance value in SUI terms + sui_balance >= liabilities, and if not, can negative equity scenarios persist undetected? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: total_sui_supply()] [Stale Value Attack] Can an attacker exploit the staleness of total_sui_supply() by calling it before refresh() to get outdated exchange rates for deposit/withdraw operations, extracting value through arbitrage? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: rebalance()] [Missing Refresh] If external state changes occur between refresh() call on line 104 and mint() call on line 113, can outdated liquid_staking_info state cause incorrect LST minting ratios? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: claim_fees()] [Stale Calculation] Since total_sui_supply is computed on line 138 after refresh but excess_sui depends on it, if another transaction modifies state before unstake_n_sui(), can excess_sui become incorrect? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: withdraw()] [Refresh Timing] If refresh() on line 86 updates liquid_staking_info but another transaction modifies validator stakes before unstake_n_sui(), can withdrawal amounts be calculated on stale data? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [View Functions] [Stale Read] Can liabilities() and sui_balance() view functions return values that are inconsistent with liquid_staking_info state when refresh() hasn't been called recently? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: total_sui_supply()] [Comment Accuracy] Does the comment on lines 44-45 warning about staleness indicate a design flaw where callers might unknowingly use incorrect values for critical accounting decisions? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: rebalance()] [Threshold Bypass] Can an attacker front-run rebalance() by withdrawing SUI to keep sui_balance just below MIN_DEPLOY_AMOUNT, preventing legitimate rebalancing and causing inefficient capital allocation? [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: rebalance()] [DoS Attack] If MIN_DEPLOY_AMOUNT is set too high (1 SUI = 1e9 mist), can small deposits never trigger rebalancing, leaving funds idle and reducing yield for users? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: rebalance()] [U64_MAX Usage] Does passing U64_MAX as stake amount on line 126 create risk of staking more than intended if liquid_staking module interprets it as maximum available rather than unlimited? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: rebalance()] [Atomic Failure] If increase_validator_stake() fails after mint() succeeds on line 113, are LST tokens minted but not staked, leaving them in lst_balance without earning rewards? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: rebalance()] [Balance Check] Since withdraw_all() is called on line 110 without checking if sui_balance == 0, can rebalance() waste gas when called on empty balance? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/staker.move] [Function: rebalance()] [Validator Lock] By always staking to SUILEND_VALIDATOR on line 125, does rebalance() create centralization risk where all funds are locked with one validator, vulnerable to validator-specific failures?
